intro: Strobilanthes evrardii, commonly known as the "Flower of the Year," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble a cluster of small, tubular flowers. The plant is typically herbaceous, with lance-shaped leaves and produces vibrant blooms in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
